data.title: Dive into anything
data.text:
For my market mode deep learning classifier, I use the following logic to label historical data and train two sets of models over 1h timeframe.

Long Horizon Model:

If during the next 15h period, price is up 8% and more, I label it "Long." If it is down 8% and more, I label it as "Short." Otherwise, I label it as "Pass."

Short Horizon Model:

If during the next 6h period, price is up 4% and more, I label it "Long." If it is low 4% and more, I label it as "Short." Otherwise, I label it as "Pass."

After training and prediction, based on these two sets of signals, I devise trading strategies. Are there better ways to label the data? Help from Data Scientists is much appreciated.
